thing-type.label: FGRM222 Roller Shutter
thing-type.description: Roller Shutter<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtFibaro Roller Shutter is a universal, Z-Wave compatible, electric motor controller. The device allows for controlling motors of roller blinds, awnings, venetian blinds, gates and others, which are single phase AC powered. Fibaro Roller Shutter allows for precise positioning of a roller blind or venetian blind lamellas. Precise positioning is available for the motors equipped with mechanic and electronic end switches.</p&gt <p&gtThe module may be controlled wirelessly, through the Z-Wave network main controller, or through the switch keys connected to it. It’s also possible to combine few devices into groups of devices, which then can be controlled simultaneously. In addition, Fibaro Roller Shutter is equipped with Power Metering.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtROLLER SHUTTER RESET</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtReset procedure clears the modules’ EPROM memory, including all information about the Z-Wave network controller, calibration and power consumption data.</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtMake sure the module is connected to the power supply.</li&gt <li&gtPress and hold the B-button for ca. 14 seconds.</li&gt <li&gtLED indicator will glow yellow.</li&gt <li&gtRelease the B-button and press it again, briefly.</li&gt <li&gtThe Roller Shutter memory is now empty.</li&gt <li&gtThe module goes into the auto inclusion mode, until any button is pushed.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtFibaro Roller Shutter may be included into the Z-Wave network via the B-button or a push button connected to the S1 terminal. In addition, the module may be included in auto inclusion mode, by simply connecting the power supply.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtAutomatic Z-Wave network inclusion:</strong&gt</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtMake sure the power supply is disconnected and a Roller Shutter is located within a direct Z-Wave network’s main controller communication range.</li&gt <li&gtSet the main controller into the learn mode (see main controllers operating manual).</li&gt <li&gtConnect the power supply to include the Roller Shutter in auto inclusion mode.</li&gt <li&gtFibaro Roller Shutter will be automatically detected and included into the Z-Wave network.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtTo disable the auto inclusion mode, press the B-button briefly, after connecting the module to the power supply.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtManual Z-Wave network inclusion:</strong&gt</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtConnect the power supply.</li&gt <li&gtSet the main controller into the learn mode (see main controllers operating manual).</li&gt <li&gtTriple click the B-button or a push button connected to the S1 terminal.</li&gt <li&gtFibaro Roller Shutter will be detected and included into the Z-Wave network</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtExcluding Fibaro Roller Shutter from the Z-Wave network:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtMake sure the module is connected to the power supply.</li&gt <li&gtSet the main controller into the learn mode (see main controllers operating manual).</li&gt <li&gtTriple click the B-button or a push button connected to the S1 terminal.</li&gt </ol&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Local protection
parameter.description: Enables/disables local protection<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnables/disables local entry. If activated module stops responding to S1 and S2 push buttons, SCENE ID and association commands will not be sent. Only exception is the B-button.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Radio protection
parameter.description: Enables/disables RF protection<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnables/disables RF protection. If activated device stops responding to command frames. Configuration and polling still possible.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Reports type
parameter.description: Enable Venetian Blind mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtParameters value shoud be set to 1 if the module operates in Venetian Blind mode.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Blind position reports sent using Z-Wave Commands
Blind position reports sent using Fibaro Commands.

parameter.name: config_12_2
parameter.label: 12: Turning time/delay time
parameter.description: Time of full turn of the lamellas.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIn Venetian Blind mode (parameter 10 set to 2) the parameter determines time of full turn of the lamellas. In Gate Mode (parameter 10 set to 3 or 4) the parameter defines the delay time after which an open gate starts closing.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_1
parameter.label: 13: Lamellas positioning mode
parameter.description: Lamellas positioning in venetian blind mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtParameter influences the lamellas positioning in venetian blind mode (parameter 10 set to 2)</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Only in case of the main controller operation
Controller, switch or limit switch operation
Controller, switch, limit sw operation/STOP frame

parameter.name: config_14_1
parameter.label: 14: Switch type
parameter.description: Parameter settings for Roller and Venetian Blind Mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtParameter settings are relevant for Roller Blind Mode and Venetian Blind Mode (parameter 10 set to 0, 1, 2).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_17_1
parameter.label: 17: Delay time after S2
parameter.description: Relays turn off time after reaching a limit switch.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIn roller blind mode or venetian blind mode (parameter 10 set to 0, 1, 2) the parameter determines when the Roller Shutter relays are turned off after reaching a limit switch. In Gate Mode (parameter 10 set to 3 or 4) the parameter determines a time period.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_18_1
parameter.label: 18: Motor operation detection
parameter.description: Power threshold to be interpreted as reaching a limit switch.

parameter.name: config_22_2
parameter.label: 22: Motor operation time
parameter.description: Time period for the motor to continue operation.

parameter.name: config_29_1
parameter.label: 29: Forced Roller Shutter calibration
parameter.description: Roller Shutter enters the calibration mode.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSeting the parameter to 1 Roller Shutter enters the calibration mode. Parameter is only only relevant if a Roller Shutter is set to work in positioning mode (parameter 10 set to 1, 2 or 4).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_32_1
parameter.label: 32: Response to Smoke, CO, CO2 Alarm

parameter.name: config_35_1
parameter.label: 35: Managing lamellas in response to alarm
parameter.description: Lamellas reaction upon alarm detection.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIn Venetian Blind Mode (parameter 10 set to 2), the parameter determines how the lamellas will react upon alarm detection.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Set lamellas to their extreme position

parameter.name: config_40_1
parameter.label: 40: Power reports
parameter.description: Power level change resulting in new power value report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtPower level change that will result in new power value report being sent. Value is a percentage of the previous report.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_42_2
parameter.label: 42: Periodic power or energy reports
parameter.description: Time to the next report. Value of 0 means the reports are turned off.

parameter.name: config_43_1
parameter.label: 43: Energy reports
parameter.description: Energy level change resulting in new energy value report<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnergy level change which will result in new energy value report being sent. Value of 0 means the reports are turned off.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_44_1
parameter.label: 44: Self-measurement
parameter.description: Enables/disables power and energy report used by itself<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnables/disables to include the power and energy used by itself in reports to main controller.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_50_1
parameter.label: 50: Scenes/Associations activation
parameter.description: Determine whether scenes or associations are activated<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtParameter determines whether scenes or associations are activated by the switch keys.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Momentary click
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<strong&gtRoller Shutter or other Z-Wave devices</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtClicking "up" button, connected to S1 terminal will initiate up movement in associated Roller Shutters, or send Turn On command frame to the devices associated in I-st association group.</p&gt <p&gtClicking "down" button, connected to S2 terminal will initiate down movement in associated Roller Shutters, or send Turn Off command frame to the devices associated in I-st association group.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtVenetian Blinds</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtClicking "up" button, connected to S1 terminal will initiate up movement of the connected venetian blind and other devices associated in I-st association group.</p&gt <p&gtClicking "down" button, connected to S2 terminal will initiate down movement of the connected venetian blind and other devices associated in I-st association group.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Momentary hold
parameter.description: Only applies to momentary switches<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<strong&gtRoller Shutter or other Z-Wave devices</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtHolding "up" button, connected to S1 terminal will move the connected roller blind up, and after 1 second delay initiate up movement in associated Roller Shutters, or send Turn On command frame to the devices associated in II-nd association group.</p&gt <p&gtHolding "down" button, connected to S2 terminal will move the connected rolled blind down, and after 1 second delay initiate down movement in associated Roller Shutters, or send Turn Off command frame to the devices associated in II-nd association group.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtVenetian Blinds</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtHolding "up" button, connected to S1 terminal will initiate lamellas rotation up, of the connected venetian blind as well as the other devices associated in II-nd association group.</p&gt <p&gtHolding "down" button, connected to S2 terminal will initiate lamellas rotation down, of the connected venetian blind as well as the other devices associated in II-nd association group.</p&gt
